required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Multiple Behavior Change on the Effectiveness of Implementation Intentions to Promote Fitness Center Visitation

lead_sponsor.agency: USDA Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center

clinical_study.source: USDA Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to explore the effects of an intervention designed to help increase physical activity and decrease screen time.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate attendance, exercise, and screen time habits in fitness center members. Because they are the population under investigation, recruitment will take place via the fitness center facilities. This population is under investigation because much of this population is sedentary and does not exercise at recommended levels, despite access to physical fitness facilities. This research will investigate methods to encourage physical activity in this population.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This study will be a between group factorial design. The between subjects variable will be group assignment. The within subjects variable will be time.

primary_outcome.description: Change in fitness center attendance as measured by number of visits per week

arm_group.description: Participants will receive information regarding the health benefits of regular aerobic and resistance training exercise and current physical activity guidelines for adults.
Participants will receive information regarding the health risks of sedentary behavior and suggestions for reducing or breaking up screen time.
Participants will receive information on the health benefits of increasing physical activity and reducing sedentary screen behavior.
Participants will receive information regarding the health risks of chronic stress as well as suggested methods to reduce stress.

intervention.description: Participants will write goals related to exercise, the most desired outcome of reaching their goals, anticipated obstacles/barriers which may prevent them from achieving their goals, and if-then statements proactively describing how to overcome or avoid obstacles.

Participants will write goals related to reducing time spent on screen-based devices during non-work hours, the most desired outcome of reaching their goals, anticipated obstacles/barriers which may prevent them from achieving their goals, and if-then statements proactively describing how to overcome or avoid obstacles.

Participants will write goals related to increasing physical activity and decreasing screen usage, the most desired outcome of reaching their goals, anticipated obstacles/barriers which may prevent them from achieving their goals, and if-then statements proactively describing how to overcome or avoid obstacles.
Participants will be asked to identify stress-reduction techniques which they can use in their daily lives and will be encouraged to practice them as necessary.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Body mass index from 25-40 kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
- have any medical conditions that prevent participant from safely taking part in physical activity
- currently a smoker
- are pregnant, breastfeeding, or plan to become pregnant
- have visited fitness centers more than eight times in the past two months
- exercise outside of fitness centers more than once a week for one hour at a time in the past month
- do not engage in more than 14 hours a week of screen-based activities
- do not have a primarily sedentary job

overall_official.affiliation: USDA Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center

facility.name: USDA Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: USDA Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center
